alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 3:42PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, McDonald. * WHEN...Until midnight CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that 1 to 2 inches of rainfall have occurred over the last 24 hours. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area, especially along and near Little Sugar Creek and Big Sugar Creek. - This includes the following low water crossings... Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Mikes Creek at Highway U, Bentonville Hollow at Highway E, Honey Creek at Highway 43, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road and Honey Creek at Oak Street. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Anderson, Noel, South West City, Lanagan, Dodge, Powell and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
